articles.headline: Merrick Garland Visits Capitol as G.O.P. Digs In Against Vote
articles.snippet: On a discordant day, Republican leaders vowed again that they would not hold hearings or a confirmation vote this year even if a Democrat wins the White House in November.
articles.abstract: On a discordant day, Republican leaders vowed again that they would not hold hearings or a confirmation vote this year even if a Democrat wins the White House in November.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Democrats enthusiastically embraced Judge Merrick B. Garland on Thursday in his first visit to the Capitol as a Supreme Court nominee, but Republican leaders, brushing aside stirrings of defections in their ranks, vowed again that they would not hold hearings or a confirmation vote this year even if a Democrat wins the White House in November.

articles.headline: Once a Darling, Spanish Solar Company Abengoa Faces Reckoning
articles.snippet: Abengoa’s global ambitions are now the source of its troubles as it tries to avoid what would be the largest bankruptcy in Spanish corporate history.
articles.abstract: Abengoa’s global ambitions are now the source of its troubles as it tries to avoid what would be the largest bankruptcy in Spanish corporate history.
articles.lead_paragraph: Announcing government support for clean-energy projects, President Obama hailed a Spanish company, saying its new solar technology would supply tens of thousands of American homes with renewable power, while spurring local employment.

articles.headline: Apple Encryption Engineers, if Ordered to Unlock iPhone, Might Resist
articles.snippet: The potential resistance adds a wrinkle to a very public fight over access to an iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino attackers.
articles.abstract: The potential resistance adds a wrinkle to a very public fight over access to an iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino attackers.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — If the F.B.I. wins its court fight to force Apple’s help in unlocking an iPhone, the agency may run into yet another roadblock: Apple’s engineers.
articles.byline: By John Markoff, Katie Benner and Brian X. Chen

articles.headline: Study Finds Public Pension Promises Exceed Ability to Pay
articles.snippet: A Citigroup report on 20 nations said pension obligations, much of them unfunded, amounted to nearly twice the countries’ total national debt.
articles.abstract: A Citigroup report on 20 nations said pension obligations, much of them unfunded, amounted to nearly twice the countries’ total national debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Detroit went bankrupt in 2013, investors were shocked to learn that the city had promised pensions worth billions more than anyone knew — creating a financial pileup that ultimately meant big, unexpected losses for Detroit’s bondholders.

articles.headline: Accuracy Concerns on Testing Device for Blood-Thinning Drug
articles.snippet: Thousands of reports say a device to measure the levels of warfarin with a drop of blood is malfunctioning, yet it remains on the market.
articles.abstract: Thousands of reports say a device to measure the levels of warfarin with a drop of blood is malfunctioning, yet it remains on the market.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dr. Gary Goldstein, a Florida internist, knew something was wrong with a blood-testing device in his office when, all of a sudden, it began giving out odd results.

articles.headline: As Hillary Clinton Sweeps States, One Group Resists: White Men
articles.snippet: White men narrowly backed Hillary Clinton in 2008, but they are not getting behind her candidacy in force in major battleground states this year, rattling some Democrats.
articles.abstract: White men narrowly backed Hillary Clinton in 2008, but they are not getting behind her candidacy in force in major battleground states this year, rattling some Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: White men narrowly backed Hillary Clinton in her 2008 race for president, but they are resisting her candidacy this time around in major battleground states, rattling some Democrats about her general-election strategy.

articles.headline: Michigan Governor Tells Congress He Was Misled on Flint Water
articles.snippet: Both Gov. Rick Snyder and Gina McCarthy, the administrator of the United States Environmental Protection Agency, were repeatedly pressed on their responsibility in the lead contamination scandal.
articles.abstract: Both Gov. Rick Snyder and Gina McCarthy, the administrator of the United States Environmental Protection Agency, were repeatedly pressed on their responsibility in the lead contamination scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Time and again, Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan acknowledged in a tense congressional hearing Thursday that he had been aware of complaints about the drinking water in Flint, including from news reports his aides had emailed him. Yet he had accepted assurances, he said, that the problems were not severe.

articles.headline: Where Merrick Garland Stands: A Close Look at His Judicial Record
articles.snippet: Mr. Garland is known as an appeals court judge who respects Supreme Court precedent. His most charged cases, on national security and campaign finance, sometimes disappointed liberals.
articles.abstract: Mr. Garland is known as an appeals court judge who respects Supreme Court precedent. His most charged cases, on national security and campaign finance, sometimes disappointed liberals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Judge Merrick B. Garland, President Obama’s Supreme Court nominee, has achieved a rare distinction in a polarized era. He has sat on a prominent appeals court for almost two decades, participated in thousands of cases, and yet earned praise from across the political spectrum.

articles.headline: ZTE Document Raises Questions About Huawei and Sanctions
articles.snippet: An internal document from ZTE, a Chinese technology company, describes efforts by a company it calls F7 to bypass United States embargoes.
articles.abstract: An internal document from ZTE, a Chinese technology company, describes efforts by a company it calls F7 to bypass United States embargoes.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — When the United States government punished ZTE of China this month, saying it had done business with Iran, it released internal company documents that it said detailed how the electronic equipment maker had done it — and that also suggested the problem might not be limited to one Chinese company.

articles.headline: Claims of Age Bias Rise, but Standards of Proof Are High
articles.snippet: Even though a law meant to protect older workers has existed since 1967, proving discrimination has since been made tougher.
articles.abstract: Even though a law meant to protect older workers has existed since 1967, proving discrimination has since been made tougher.
articles.lead_paragraph: Julianne Taaffe and Kathryn Moon had been teaching English language skills to foreign students for decades at Ohio State University when they and their co-workers were jolted by a particularly blunt email.

articles.headline: Salah Abdeslam, Suspect in Paris Attacks, Is Captured in Brussels
articles.snippet: Mr. Abdeslam had evaded the authorities for four months; his fingerprint was found in a residence raided by the police this week.
articles.abstract: Mr. Abdeslam had evaded the authorities for four months; his fingerprint was found in a residence raided by the police this week.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — He traveled back to Belgium unrecognized and unchallenged the day after the Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris. His fingerprints were found in two apartments in Brussels in subsequent months, but he kept eluding the police dragnet, amid speculation that he might have escaped to Syria.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Alissa J. Rubin

articles.headline: As Women Take Over a Male-Dominated Field, the Pay Drops
articles.snippet: Work done by women pays less because women do it, research shows.
articles.abstract: Work done by women pays less because women do it, research shows.
articles.lead_paragraph: Women’s median annual earnings stubbornly remain about 20 percent below men’s. Why is progress stalling?

articles.headline: From Kefir to ‘Cucamelons,’ Sampling the Next Wave of Natural Foods
articles.snippet: A guided tour of the Natural Products Expo West trade show in California offers insight into where natural and organic food trends are headed.
articles.abstract: A guided tour of the Natural Products Expo West trade show in California offers insight into where natural and organic food trends are headed.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANAHEIM, Calif. — If you had any remaining doubts about the popularity of organic and so-called natural foods, a visit to the Anaheim Convention Center here last week would have dispelled them. Inside its five vast halls, more than 3,000 exhibitors showed their wares to some 77,000 retailers, suppliers, investors and curiosity-seekers as part of the Natural Products Expo West, known among foodies as simply Expo West. Organic kefir, anyone?

articles.headline: When an Analyst Has a Stake in the Stock He Picks
articles.snippet: Buried in the footnotes of an analyst’s recommendation to buy Tempur Sealy shares is a disclosure that he may receive compensation from the company.
articles.abstract: Buried in the footnotes of an analyst’s recommendation to buy Tempur Sealy shares is a disclosure that he may receive compensation from the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: File this column under: Why It Pays to Read the Footnotes.
